userStories.title: Append-only transparency log
userStories.description: As a system, I want append-only storage of leaf hashes so inclusion proofs are stable and tamper-evident.
acceptanceCriteria: POST /v1/logs/:log_id/append inserts one leaf hash under a Durable Object keyed by log_id
Reject duplicate leaf hashes to keep proof-by-hash deterministic
userStories.notes: Implemented via LogDurableObject with per-log leaf storage and strict leaf hash validation.

userStories.title: Signed roots + inclusion proofs
userStories.description: As an auditor, I want signed roots and inclusion proofs so I can independently verify log membership.
acceptanceCriteria: Root signatures use Ed25519 over the root_hash_b64u string
userStories.notes: Merkle proofs use sha256(left||right), duplicate-last for odd levels, with root signatures emitted from LOGS_SIGNING_KEY.

userStories.title: Transparency log inclusion proofs (clawlogs)
userStories.description: As a third party, I want portable inclusion proofs for clawlogs so attestations can be independently verified against a transparency log root.
userStories.notes: Service implemented under services/clawlogs with spec doc and golden-vector tests.
